intro: Gymnolaena serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf gymnolaena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are serrated and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Gymnolaena serratifolia produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in late spring to early summer.
